name: blackmailed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
blackmail
C2 to get money from someone by blackmail: They used the photographs to blackmail her into spying for them.
More examplesFewer examplesWhen he found out about my affair he tried to blackmail me.A computer hacker's attempt to blackmail the bank was foiled by detectives last month.The gang thought they could use the photographs to blackmail the pop star.If someone is blackmailing you, you really must inform the police.The film is about a city dealer who is blackmailing his boss.
